pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors

Class BinaryVectorUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • pitt.search.semanticvectors.vectors.BinaryVectorUtils

  • public class BinaryVectorUtils
extends Object
    This class provides standard vector methods, e.g., cosine measure, normalization, tensor utils.

    • Method Detail

      • orthogonalizeVectors

        public static boolean orthogonalizeVectors(List<Vector> list)
        The orthogonalize function takes an array of vectors and makes them dissimilar from one another (Hamming distance = n/2) in a manner analogous to the Gram-Schmidt process with real vectors. The vectors are altered in place, so there is no return value. Note that the output of this function is order dependent, in particular, the jth vector in the array will be made orthogonal to all the previous vectors. Since this means that the last vector is disimilar from all the others, this can be used as a negation function to give an vector for vectors[last] NOT (vectors[0] OR ... OR vectors[last - 1].
        Parameters:
        list - vectors to be orthogonalized in place.

      • compareWithProjection

        public static double compareWithProjection(Vector testVector,
                           ArrayList<Vector> vectors)
        Binary equivalent of comparing to projection in a subspace as occurs with real and complex vectors The score is the sum of any overlap greater than 50% across all vector components of the binary pseudo-subspace

      • intersection

      • sampleSubtract

        public static void sampleSubtract(org.apache.lucene.util.FixedBitSet vector,
                  org.apache.lucene.util.FixedBitSet subvector)
        This method provides the equivalent of orthogonalization for binary vectors. Rather than making vector k orthogonal to vector j, we alter vector j so it has a Hamming distance of n/2 to vector k. This is the analog of orthogonality in real/complex space.
